newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: WELNA OPERATING PROFIT UP 30 PCT IN Q1.
newsitem.headline: WELNA OPERATING PROFIT UP 30 PCT IN Q1.

text.p: Industrial components firm Welna NV said on Friday its sales had grown by about 14 percent and its operating profit by about 30 percent in the first quarter of 1997 compared with the same period of 1996.
Welna also said it had agreed in principle to acquire a 40 percent stake in British plastics processing firm Garlway, with an option to increase this to a majority holding from 1999.
Welna has also raised its stake in Polish glass-fibre reinforced plastics firm Metalchem-Andren to 96 percent from 68 percent. The Polish firm has been renamed Metalchem Plasticon.
Welna said these deals would mostly be paid for in cash, with a small portion paid in shares, and would make an immediate contribution to its profits and earnings per share.
In 1996 Welna's net profit rose 23.5 percent to 4.6 million guilders on sales of 107.6 million guilders.
